page.title: 08SCHOOLS CONTINUED
page.content: {ST. MARK'S SCHOOL, STAPLEFIELD. This school was built in 1849.The school has three main classrooms and one dining room. The school is made of sandstone and iron. The school is heated by oil and it is lit by electricity. In the summer the boys play cricket, tennis, and the girls play netball, stoolball and tennis.After school they play tennis, football and rounders. There are 60 children in the school divided into 3 classes of ages 5-7,7-9 and 9-11. Most children live locally,50% live less than a mile away,45% live less than 5 miles away,5% live more than 5 miles away. The children learn Maths,English, French, Religious Education, Science and Music.
